{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560252,"name":"Drew Robertson","username":"amazinghawkman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/8baadc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T05:21:19.599Z","cooked":"

We’re having an issue where our Limelights are fully functional in code and accessible via their web interfaces (IP addresses) and Limelight Finder, but they do not appear in the CameraServer section of WPILib Shuffleboard. This means we can’t push the feeds to Shuffleboard for viewing during matches.

Some key details:
• The Limelights work as expected in our code and can be accessed through their web interfaces.
• They also show up in Limelight Finder.
• However, they do not appear under CameraServer in Shuffleboard.
• We are trying to display the feeds in Shuffleboard for driver feedback during matches.

Has anyone encountered this issue before? Are there any steps we should take to ensure the feeds show up in CameraServer?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Although maybe not your issue: shuffleboard is on the way out the door and long term it’s time to look at replacing it in your workflows.

What version of shuffleboard? Upgrading to the latest 2025 version may help (currently 2025.3.1), as there were issues with the kickoff release version.
